QuestionText: What is the main purpose of encapsulation in OOP?
OptionB: To inherit properties from a parent class

QuestionText: Which of the following is a characteristic of inheritance in OOP?
OptionA: A child class can inherit properties from multiple parent classes
OptionB: A child class can only inherit properties from a single parent class
OptionC: A child class cannot inherit properties from a parent class
OptionD: A parent class can inherit properties from a child class

QuestionText: What does the term 'polymorphism' mean in OOP?
OptionA: The ability of an object to take on multiple forms
OptionB: The ability of an object to perform a single task
OptionC: The ability of an object to interact with other objects
OptionD: The ability of an object to hide internal implementation details

QuestionText: What is the purpose of an abstract class in OOP?
OptionA: To provide a blueprint for other classes to follow
OptionB: To provide a fully implemented class that can be instantiated
OptionC: To provide a class that can be used as a base class for other classes
OptionD: To provide a class that cannot be instantiated

QuestionText: What is a constructor in OOP?
OptionA: A method that is called when an object is created
OptionB: A method that is called when an object is destroyed
OptionC: A method that is used to retrieve data from an object
OptionD: A method that is used to modify data in an object

QuestionText: What is the term for a class that cannot be inherited from?
What is the purpose of an interface in OOP?
OptionA: To provide a fully implemented class that can be instantiated
OptionB: To provide a blueprint for other classes to follow
OptionC: To provide a way for classes to communicate with each other
OptionD: To provide a way for classes to hide internal implementation details

QuestionText: What does the term 'abstraction' mean in OOP?
OptionA: Hiding internal implementation details and showing only necessary information
OptionC: Inheriting properties from a parent class
OptionD: Providing a fully implemented class that can be instantiated

QuestionText: What is the purpose of a getter method in OOP?
OptionA: To set the value of a private field
OptionB: To retrieve the value of a private field
OptionC: To modify the value of a private field
OptionD: To delete the value of a private field
